name: MongoDB (npx)
description: Connect to MongoDB databases and Atlas clusters. Query collections, inspect schemas, manage indexes, and run aggregation pipelines through the official MongoDB MCP server.

inputs.label: MongoDB Connection String
inputs.description: MongoDB connection URI for your database. Supports local instances, Atlas clusters, and replica sets. Leave empty to use the runtime connect tool.

obtain.instructions:
1. For MongoDB Atlas: Go to your cluster > Connect > Drivers
2. Copy the connection string
3. Replace <password> with your database password
4. For local MongoDB: use mongodb://localhost:27017/mydb

inputs.label: Atlas API Client ID
inputs.description: MongoDB Atlas Service Account client ID for Atlas management operations (create clusters, manage users, IP access lists). Optional â€” only needed for Atlas administration.

obtain.instructions:
1. Go to MongoDB Atlas > Organization Settings > Service Accounts
2. Create a new Service Account with required roles
3. Copy the Client ID

inputs.label: Atlas API Client Secret
inputs.description: MongoDB Atlas Service Account client secret. Required when Atlas API Client ID is provided.

obtain.instructions:
1. Go to MongoDB Atlas > Organization Settings > Service Accounts
2. Create or select a Service Account
3. Copy the Client Secret (shown only once at creation)

auth.instructions: Connection string provides database access. Atlas API credentials (optional) enable cluster management features.
